 : GRADE A PLUS in ACSI4	Jocelyne Saade	jocelyne.j.saade@gmail.com	GRADE A PLUS	Personally and professionally, I'm driven by the urgent need to address both environmental challenges and economic hardship in Lebanon, particularly in the Aarsal region. We aim to address key targets within this goal, promoting sustainable land use and biodiversity conservation. Our quantifiable impact metrics include: 1. Land Restoration: Through partnerships with organizations like the Lebanon Reforestation Initiative (LRI) NGO, we conducted experiments on 120 trees planted in December 2023, contributing to Target 15.3 (land degradation neutrality). Future collaborations, such as the upcoming pilot project with GreenLeb in March 2024, further this goal. 2. Biodiversity Enhancement: We seek to boost biodiversity by promoting natural fertilizers. Target 15.9, emphasizing the integration of ecosystems and biodiversity into planning, guides our efforts, with a targeted 20% increase in the diversity of flora and fauna where our pellets are applied. 3. Water Conservation: Anticipating a 25% reduction in water consumption for irrigation, our pellets, by reducing the need for chemical fertilizers and enhancing soil water retention, contribute to sustainable agricultural practices. 4. Economic Empowerment: Contributing to SDG 1 and SDG 8, our initiative creates income streams for shepherds and generates jobs. We currently empower eight families in our workshop and 15 shepherd families annually. As our business expands, we aim to uplift more families out of poverty. 5. Carbon Emission Reduction: While indirectly linked to SDG 15, our efforts reduce the burning of sheep wool and the carbon footprint in agriculture, contributing to SDG 13. Over our three working years, we have successfully reduced 200 tons of CO2 emissions.Through these quantifiable goals, we envision a holistic impact aligned with SDG 15 and intersecting with other critical sustainability objectives.	Entrepreneurship:::Tech & Innovation	"4.2. Simultaneously, Lebanese farmers, particularly in regions like Aarsal, face severe economic challenges due to high input costs. Our data, for example, shows conventional fertilizer costing $278.5 per 320m², hindering profitability. We identified this dual problem through direct observation of both the pervasive waste and the struggles of local farmers. Our data analysis, demonstrating SoilPlus's ability to significantly reduce costs and increase profits (with a 293% ROI), confirmed the viability of our upcycling solution. This provides a sustainable and economically beneficial alternative, turning a waste problem into a resource for struggling farmers.	Our Startup: GRADE A PLUS GRADE A PLUS is a Lebanese startup dedicated to transforming environmental challenges into sustainable economic opportunities. We address the pressing issue of sheep wool waste, of which Lebanon generates 2,500 tons annually, by upcycling it into high-value agricultural and other sustainable products. Recognizing the economic hardships faced by Lebanese farmers, particularly in regions like Aarsal, we've developed innovative solutions that not only mitigate waste but also enhance agricultural productivity and profitability. Our Solution: SoilPlus and SoilPlus Pro Our flagship products, SoilPlus and SoilPlus Pro, are soil enhancers made from 100% upcycled sheep wool. They offer a sustainable alternative to conventional fertilizers, addressing both environmental and economic concerns. •	SoilPlus: As shown in the provided data, SoilPlus demonstrates exceptional cost-effectiveness. With a total cost of $194.8 per 320m², it significantly reduces input costs for farmers compared to conventional 20-20-20 fertilizer, which costs $278.5. Moreover, despite a lower initial investment, SoilPlus delivers the highest profit ($570.7) and a remarkable 293% return on investment (ROI), primarily attributed to the higher selling price per kg ($0.8) of the produce grown with it. •	SoilPlus Pro: While slightly more costly at $221.6 per 320m², SoilPlus Pro also offers a cost-effective solution compared to conventional fertilizers. It delivers a substantial yield (1255.25 kg) and a profit of $280.5, representing a 127% ROI. Key Benefits: •	Cost Reduction: Both SoilPlus and SoilPlus Pro significantly reduce input costs for farmers compared to conventional fertilizers. •	Increased Profitability: SoilPlus, in particular, demonstrates a significantly higher profit margin and ROI. •	Sustainable Agriculture: By upcycling sheep wool, we reduce waste and promote environmentally friendly farming practices. •	Improved Soil Health: Our products enhance soil structure and water retention, leading to healthier crops. •	Local Economic Development: We support Lebanese farmers and contribute to the economic resilience of rural communities. Our Vision: We envision a future where waste is transformed into valuable resources, and sustainable agriculture empowers Lebanese farmers. GRADE A PLUS is committed to leading this transformation by providing innovative, eco-friendly solutions that benefit both people and the planet. Exploring ideas, conducting market/customer research"	2	No	No sales yet	No	No	N/A	NA	Problem Statement: Syrian professionals, freelancers, and fresh graduates face significant barriers in accessing job opportunities, both locally and internationally. These challenges include:  Lack of Job Opportunities – Many skilled individuals struggle to find work that matches their expertise. Limited Global Connections – Syrian freelancers often lack direct access to international clients and businesses. Payment & Financial Restrictions – Due to banking sanctions, most international payment platforms (e.g., PayPal) are inaccessible, making it difficult for freelancers to receive payments securely. Trust & Quality Concerns – Clients hesitate to hire freelancers due to uncertainties about work quality and payment security. How I Identified the Problem: As a professional deeply involved in business and economic challenges in Syria, I noticed that many highly skilled Syrians were struggling to find work despite their talent. Conversations with freelancers, students, and professionals highlighted the same recurring issues: a lack of access to jobs, difficulty in receiving payments, and a lack of trust between service providers and clients.  Through market research and discussions with both service seekers and providers, it became clear that SyrConn could bridge this gap by creating a secure, structured digital marketplace where Syrian professionals could connect with global clients while ensuring safe transactions and quality work delivery	Startup Overview: SyrConn – Connecting Syrian Creators with the World SyrConn is a digital freelance marketplace designed to empower Syrian professionals, freelancers, and students by connecting them with global job opportunities in a secure and structured environment. The platform enables service providers—such as developers, designers, engineers, writers, and marketers—to offer their skills to international clients without financial or logistical barriers.  Solution: How SyrConn Solves the Problem SyrConn directly addresses the challenges faced by Syrian freelancers by offering:  A Digital Job Marketplace – A specialized online platform where Syrian professionals can showcase their skills and connect with businesses worldwide. Secure Payment Processing – A built-in escrow system that ensures freelancers receive their earnings without needing external banking solutions like PayPal. Quality Assurance & Trust – A review and rating system backed by industry professionals to ensure high-quality service delivery. International Access & Opportunities – Direct connections to global businesses, startups, and NGOs seeking skilled professionals at competitive rates. Scalable Revenue Model – SyrConn generates revenue through a 15% commission on transactions and premium memberships for enhanced visibility and job access. By removing financial restrictions, ensuring job security, and creating a reliable ecosystem, SyrConn empowers Syrian professionals to thrive in the global digital economy—unlocking new economic opportunities for thousands. سنويًا.  انخفاض إنتاجية المحاصيل بنسبة 20-40% بسبب التربة غير الخصبة وصعوبة الاحتفاظ بالماء.  بعض المزارعين اضطروا إلى التخلي عن أراضيهم بسبب عدم جدوى الزراعة اقتصاديًا.    3. مراجعة سياسات واستراتيجيات التنمية الزراعية:  الحكومة والمنظمات الدولية تدعم تقنيات الحفاظ على المياه، لكن الحلول الحالية مثل التحلية أو الري الذكي مكلفة جدًا أو غير مناسبة للزراعة واسعة النطاق.     كيف يحل الطين الصناعي المشكلة؟  يقلل استهلاك المياه بنسبة 40-60% عبر تحسين قدرة التربة على الاحتفاظ بالرطوبة.  يزيد إنتاجية المحاصيل بنسبة 30-50% من خلال توفير بيئة زراعية أكثر استقرارًا.  يخفض تكاليف الزراعة بنسبة 20-35%، مما يجعلها أكثر جدوى للمزارعين المحليين.  يساعد في إعادة تأهيل الأراضي الصحراوية، مما يساهم في إبطاء التصحر وتحقيق الأمن الغذائي. 	وصف المشروع الناشئ  مشروعي هو "الطين الصناعي للزراعة في الصحراء"، وهو حل مبتكر لمواجهة تحديات الزراعة في المناطق الجافة مثل المفرق. يعتمد المشروع على تطوير مادة طينية صناعية صديقة للبيئة، تُضاف إلى التربة لتحسين قدرتها على الاحتفاظ بالمياه والمواد المغذية، مما يساعد في زراعة المحاصيل بكفاءة أعلى وباستهلاك مياه أقل.  الحل الذي يقدمه المشروع  1. تقليل استهلاك المياه في الزراعة  بفضل قدرة الطين الصناعي على الاحتفاظ بالرطوبة، يمكن تقليل الحاجة إلى الري بنسبة 40-60%، مما يجعل الزراعة أكثر استدامة في المناطق القاحلة.    2. زيادة إنتاجية المحاصيل  يحسن الطين الصناعي من هيكل التربة، مما يسمح للجذور بالاستفادة من المياه والعناصر الغذائية بفعالية، ما يؤدي إلى زيادة الإنتاج الزراعي بنسبة 30-50%.    3. خفض تكاليف الزراعة  تقليل الحاجة إلى الأسمدة والري المتكرر يؤدي إلى خفض التكاليف التشغيلية بنسبة 20-35%، مما يجعل الزراعة أكثر جدوى اقتصاديًا للمزارعين.    4. إعادة تأهيل الأراضي الصحراوية  يمكن استخدام الطين الصناعي في تحويل الأراضي المتدهورة إلى أراضٍ زراعية قابلة للإنتاج، مما يساعد في مكافحة التصحر وزيادة المساحات الخضراء.    5. منتج صديق للبيئة ومستدام  الطين الصناعي مصنوع من مواد طبيعية وقابلة للتحلل، مما يجعله بديلاً مستدامًا للأسمدة الكيميائية وحلاً بيئيًا طويل الأمد.     لماذا هذا الحل مبتكر؟  يعتمد على تقنية منخفضة التكلفة وسهلة التطبيق مقارنة بالحلول الأخرى مثل تحلية المياه أو أنظمة الري الذكي.  يستهدف المناطق القاحلة التي تعاني من ندرة المياه، مما يجعله حلاً عمليًا للمجتمعات الزراعية في الأردن وخارجه. Have started developing my idea	4	No	No sales yet	No	No	N/A	https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1j7Jg_YCWoEs6yZ8oAr9Iih3C5s2yKyoa/edit?usp=sharing&ouid=109267772013789404405&rtpof=true&sd=true	Plastic pollution is a critical environmental challenge, particularly in coastal areas, where improperly managed plastic waste contaminates marine ecosystems, disrupts livelihoods, and contributes to climate change. Many waste collectors lack direct access to buyers, resulting in low earnings, inefficiencies in recycling, and a disconnect between waste sources and manufacturers. During our involvement in coastal clean-up initiatives, we observed massive plastic accumulation along shorelines and waterways. Conversations with local waste pickers and community members revealed key challenges: Limited market access: Collectors struggle to find consistent buyers, often relying on middlemen who offer low prices. Lack of fair compensation: Manual collection is labor-intensive, yet collectors earn little due to pricing inefficiencies. Inefficient recycling systems: Manufacturers face difficulties sourcing high-quality, sorted recyclables. This gap between waste collection and recycling markets led us to develop a tech-enabled solution—a digital waste marketplace that connects collectors directly to buyers, ensuring fair pay, efficient transactions, and increased plastic recycling rates.	Our startup, Coastal Clean Up, is a tech-driven circular economy venture that focuses on tackling plastic pollution in coastal regions. However, this offline approach failed because there were no smart online solution systems available to quickly locate leaks, define the type of contamination, and alert users to any unusual usage.   Moreover, the same thing happened when they were staying at different buildings and hotels in urban areas in the Middle East and Africa for events and learned there was a problem with water leaks; those hotels forced them to move to another floor because they needed to perform urgent maintenance due to the damage caused by the leaks; it was noisy, and they were very unhappy about it. The program aims to empower changemakers facing crises by providing them with the resources to develop impactful, sustainable solutions for their communities.  BLOOM.PM  Key Program Features Funding: Receive seed funding of up to $3,830 to help develop and scale your social enterprise.  Training & Mentorship: Engage in weekly training sessions, hands-on mentorship, and expert-led workshops that cover key topics like pitching, business model refinement, and resilience-building.  Networking Opportunities: Build connections with mentors, peers, investors, and ecosystem partners. Demo Day provides a platform to showcase your venture to potential funders and collaborators.  Trauma-Informed Support: In recognition of the challenging environments many participants face, the program offers tailored support addressing wellbeing and resilience.  BLOOM.PM  Program Structure Community of Practice:  Connect with social innovators across the region. Participate in expert-led discussions, resource sharing, and collaborative problem-solving. Bootcamp (March–April 2025):  Intensive two-week phase for shortlisted enterprises. Focus on refining pitches, improving prototypes, and strengthening business models. Culminates with a Bootcamp Demo Day. Accelerator (April–August 2025):  For teams that graduate from Bootcamp. Offers deeper training, dedicated mentorship, and further seed funding. Concludes with a final Demo Day to pitch to investors and partners.  BLOOM.PM Open House Sessions Before the application deadline, three virtual Open House sessions will be held:  February 13, 2025 (5:00–6:30 PM GMT+2): Fuel Your Personal & Startup Growth Speakers: Dara Mouracade, David Munir Nabti  February 18, 2025 (5:00–6:30 PM GMT+2): Accelerate Your Social Impact Enterprise in a Day Speaker: David Munir Nabti  February 20, 2025 (4:00–5:30 PM GMT+2): Resilience in Action — Tools for Growth and Renewal Speakers: Fadi El Halabi, Mirna Abi Aad Abi Nassif  Participants will receive calendar invites and have the opportunity to ask questions and network with the program team.  BLOOM.PM  Eligibility & Focus Themes Who Should Apply:  Target Participants: Idea-stage and prototype-stage social enterprises with at least two active team members. Focus Areas: Sustainability, good governance, independent media, active citizenship, lifelong learning, innovation, and systems change. Geographical Focus: Applicants must be based in Lebanon, Jordan, Palestine, or be part of the Syrian diaspora. Note: Single-founder teams or those already engaged in another accelerator (without clear role separation) are not eligible.  BLOOM.PM Timeline Applications Open: February 3, 2025 Open House Sessions: February 13, 18, & 20, 2025 Application Deadline: February 24, 2025 Bootcamp Notification: March 3, 2025 Bootcamp Begins: March 13, 2025 (2-week intensive) Bootcamp Demo Day: April 3, 2025 Accelerator Selection: April 11, 2025 Accelerator Begins: April 22, 2025 (3-month program) Final Demo Day: August 12, 2025 BLOOM.PM Application Process Eligibility Check: Confirm that your team meets the criteria. Submit Application: Complete the online application via the Bloom Platform between February 3 and February 24, 2025. Selection: A review panel will evaluate applications based on team composition, impact potential, value proposition, and traction.
